The patient was seen in primary care clinic on with burning with urination and increased frequency. A urine analysis was positive for nitrites and large amount of leukocyte esterase. The patient took two days of ciprofloxacin with improvement in her dysuria. The urine culture grew > 100,000 Klebsiella sensitive only to Meropenem so the patient admitted for IV antibiotics (Day 1 . Sensitivities were sent for ertapenem and fosfomycin, to determine if patient could have a more convenient regimen at discharge. The klebsiella was sensitive to fosfomycin, and transplant ID was consulted for approval of the medication and dosing instructions. She was discharged on fosfomycin 3 g q3days to complete at total 14 day course of treatment. # ESRD: s/p DDRT . Baseline Creat 0.8-0.9. You came to us because you were having burning with urination. We found that you had a urinary tract infection with a bacteria that was resistant to many antibiotics. Please remember to take all of your medications as prescribed.
